conclusion: Choose a convenient coordinate frame with CC at origin, AA at (-R,0), BB at (0,R), and arc AB as x^2+y^2=R^2.
The parallel light beam travels horizontally from left to right (parallel to AC).
Locate point P on the curved surface with vertical distance above AC as yP=√3/2 R and xP=-R/2.
Locate point M on the flat side BC with height above CC as yM=√3/3 R and xM=0.
Determine the direction of the refracted ray inside the glass as v=(R/2, -√3/6 R) with unit direction vector v^=(√3/2, -1/2).
The ray is inclined 30° below the horizontal inside the glass.
Determine the outward normal to the curved surface at P as n=(-1/2, √3/2), making 60° above the positive x-axis.
The angle of incidence is i=60° as the incoming air ray is horizontal.
The angle of refraction r inside the glass is 30°.
Apply Snell's law: n=sin i/sin r=√3.
The refractive index of the glass column is √3 (≈1.732).
